title: Example analysis
text: far, GHE supervised 108 projects 25 done BSc 83 MSc students.  next chart shows type projects supervised. Bachelor’s students exclusively theses, Master’s students semester projects theses, latter represented frequently.  number students risen steadily years, number Bachelor’s students doubling 2023 2024. number Master’s students risen slowly comparison, still significantly higher absolute numbers.  Finally, word cloud shows frequently used terms thesis titles. larger font, frequently term used. noted terms reduced stems (e.g. ‘design’, ‘designing’, ‘designed’ become ‘design’).
code: undergrad_students <- people |>    filter(b_m_student == "yes") |>   filter(!is.na(title)) undergrad_students |>    count(degree) |>    ggplot(aes(x = degree, y = n, label = n)) +   geom_col() +   geom_label() +   labs(x = "Degree",        y = "Number of students") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),         axis.text.y = element_blank()) undergrad_students |>    count(degree, type) |>    ggplot(aes(x = degree, y = n, label = n, fill = type, color = type)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   geom_text(position=position_dodge(width=0.9),              vjust=-0.5,             show.legend = FALSE) +   labs(x = "Degree",        y = "Number of students") +   scale_fill_colorblind() +   scale_color_colorblind() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),         axis.text.y = element_blank()) undergrad_students |>    count(degree, year) |>    ggplot(aes(x = year, y = n, label = n, fill = degree, color = degree)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   geom_text(position=position_dodge(width=0.9),              vjust=-0.5,             show.legend = FALSE) +   labs(x = "",        y = "Number of students") +   scale_fill_colorblind() +   scale_color_colorblind() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),         axis.text.y = element_blank()) library(quanteda) #> Package version: 4.1.0 #> Unicode version: 14.0 #> ICU version: 71.1 #> Parallel computing: disabled #> See https://quanteda.io for tutorials and examples. library(quanteda.textplots)  textcorpus <- corpus(undergrad_students$thesis_title)  wordcloud <- textcorpus |>    tokens(remove_punct = TRUE) |>   tokens_remove(pattern = stopwords('english')) |>   dfm() |>   dfm_trim(min_termfreq = 2, verbose = FALSE) |>    dfm_wordstem()  set.seed(100) textplot_wordcloud(wordcloud,                    color = c('#004777', '#A30000', '#FF7700'))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schöbitz L (2025). ghedata: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/global-health-engineering/ghedata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ghedata: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Lars Schöbitz},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/global-health-engineering/ghedata}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal ghedata share data resources document work Global Health Engineering group ETH Zurich. data can used research, teaching, learning purposes. data available R data package, CSV XLSX formats.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version ghedata GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("global-health-engineering/ghedata") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra) library(ggthemes) library(ggplot2)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package provides access one data resource.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: dataset people contains data people worked group. includes staff, well undergraduate student projects. 129 observations 7 variables. overview variable names, see following table.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: far, GHE supervised 108 projects 25 done BSc 83 MSc students.
code: library(ghedata)  undergrad_students <- people |>    filter(b_m_student == "yes") |>   filter(!is.na(title)) undergrad_students |>    count(degree, year) |>    ggplot(aes(x = year, y = n, label = n, fill = degree, color = degree)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   geom_text(position=position_dodge(width=0.9),              vjust=-0.5,             show.legend = FALSE) +   labs(x = "",        y = "Number of students") +   scale_fill_colorblind() +   scale_color_colorblind() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),         axis.text.y = element_blank())

what: people: A registry of all people that have worked for Global Health Engineering, including undergraduate student projects. — people
title: people: A registry of all people that have worked for Global Health Engineering, including undergraduate student projects. — people
people: A registry of all people that have worked for Global Health Engineering, including undergraduate student projects. — people
people: A registry of all people that have worked for Global Health Engineering, including undergraduate student projects. — people
text: tibble 96 rows 7 variables project_id Unique identifier person using combination metadata. Folder name Google Drive. degree Categorical variable four levels: bsc, msc, phd, staff. type Categorical variable six levels: hiwi, intern, post-doc, scientific-assitant, sem-proj, thesis. b_m_student Binary variable identify person BSc MSc students. Levels: yes, . start_date Start date person. year Year start date. thesis_title Title thesis.
